intro: Ovieda silenoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Ovieda silenoides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
